thread.title: Marcs, David Lawrence: 13 stores to close
thread.title_full: Marcs, David Lawrence: 13 stores to close

author: Catie Low
title: Marcs, David Lawrence: 13 stores to close
text:
Marcs, David Lawrence: 13 stores to close Catie Low twitter TWEET More 
Administrators of troubled fashion retailers David Lawrence and Marcs will close 13 stores, leaving 20 workers without jobs. 
Geoff Reidy, director of Rodgers Reidy, says the decision was made after a review of the businesses, which were placed in voluntary administration on February 2 . Marcs, David Lawrence in voluntary ... Marcs, David Lawrence in voluntary administration 
The companies behind fashion brands David Lawrence and Marcs have been placed in voluntary administration. Vision courtesy ABC News 24. Up Next Wesfarmers half-year mixed bag Wesfarmers half-year mixed bag 
The retail giant reported strong results from Bunnings, Kmart and Officeworks, but a decline in earnings from Coles and Target. Up Next Kerry Stokes surprises journalists Kerry Stokes surprises journalists 
Seven West Media chairman Kerry Stokes takes part in a half-year results call dominated by questions about CEO Tim Worner and ex-employee Amber Harrison. Up Next 
The Commonwealth Bank of Australia has released its half-year earnings report. Up Next Robb Scott named new Wesfarmers CEO Play Video Robb Scott named new Wesfarmers CEO Robb Scott named new Wesfarmers CEO 
Wesfarmers announces Rob Scott will succeed Richard Goyder, who will step down from the role towards the end of this year. Vision courtesy ABC News 24. Up Next Apple shares surpass record high Play Video Apple shares surpass record high Apple shares surpass record high 
A rally in US financial and industrial stocks pushes the S&P 500's market capitalisation above $20 trillion. Up Next Samsung chief grilled in graft probe Play Video Samsung chief grilled in graft probe Samsung chief grilled in graft probe 
Samsung Group leader Jay Y. Lee appears at the South Korean special prosecutor's office for a second round of questioning as part of a wider investigation into an influence-peddling scandal that could topple President Park Geun-hye. Up Next Tax office's amazing excuses revealed Play Video Tax office's amazing excuses revealed Tax office's amazing excuses revealed 
The Australian Tax Office receives some creative and colourful excuses when people fail to lodge their tax returns. More videos Marcs, David Lawrence in voluntary administration 
The companies behind fashion brands David Lawrence and Marcs have been placed in voluntary administration. Vision courtesy ABC News 24. 
Nine David Lawrence stores and four Marcs outlets will close by February 21 and 10 full-time staff and another 10 part-time staff will be made redundant. 
The chains are owned through veteran retailer and Jigsaw co-founder Malcolm Websters's M. Webster Holdings and Webster Asset in Australia and trade through 52 standalone stores in Australia and New Zealand as well as 11 outlet shops and 140 concessions in major retailers, including Myer and David Jones.
